text: I've always liked the call even when I
was a kid I used to go to school no no
no Jack and I used to send me home to
come to school if not Jackie as a
lifelong resident of Brighton Beach in
Brooklyn
Gary Atlas used to get a kick out of
seeing the old robust Russians in the
neighborhood taking their chilly morning
dips in the ocean something about it
seemed to keep them happy and healthy
thought I stood about 38 degrees now 38
39 degrees and it goes down to about 34
maybe in another month or two another
six weeks by February but it's a
pleasure out here I haven't gotten sick
since I started swimming every day and
thus what was good for your skin
I also gargle with this salt water any
bugs and herring any dirt no water if it
doesn't kill you it makes you stronger
on September 21st 2007 he began a daily
routine that included a six mile run
always shirtless along the beach and
boardwalk from his oceanfront apartment
building past the famous Coney Island
attractions and back after which he
would strip down and take a nice swim in
the ocean whatever the weather whatever
the water temperature Gary says he began
his daily routine as a relief from this
depression and emotional strain while
unemployed in tending to his mother who
was dying from emphysema just to relieve
the stress cuz I was really breaking
down mentally and physically I I needed
to just be out away from her for a while
for now Enid passed away in 2009 but
Gary has kept his routine going in her
memory
afterwards he drifts dry and knocks
around the boardwalk where he seems to
know everyone even the old Russian
ladies with their fur coats and walkers
god bless him I tell you one thing I see
him every day middle of the winter
last week the blizzard in the water so
it's it's an amazing thing you know his
levels must be excellent you know that
the levels got to be great you check you
do you check your levels often
during 35 years all right 37 years
imagine a that's why still with us god
bless you
